sections.raw_content: The Draw.Polygon procedure is used to draw a polygon with n points. A line is drawn in Color from the point (x(1), y(1)) to (x(2), y(2)) to (x(3), y(3)) and so on. After drawing the line to (x(n), y (n)), a line will be drawn back to (x(1), y(1)), closing the polygon. The Draw.Polygon procedure is equivalent to:

sections.raw_content: This program will create an octagon and display it in color 1.
sections.mdown_content: This program will create an octagon and display it in color 1.

sections.title: Details
sections.raw_content:
The IBM PC limits Draw.Polygon to a maximum of 256 points.

The screen must be in a "graphics" mode. See the View.Set procedure for details. If the screen is not in a "graphics" mode, an error will occur.
sections.mdown_content:
The IBM PC limits **Draw.Polygon** to a maximum of 256 points.
The screen must be in a "*graphics*" mode. See the **View.Set** procedure for details. If the screen is not in a "*graphics*" mode, an error will occur.

sections.title: Status
sections.raw_content:
Exported qualified.

This means that you can only call the function by calling Draw.Polygon, not by calling Polygon.
